intro: Ardisia albipedicellata, commonly known as the white-fruited beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces striking, spherical berries that turn from white to red as they mature. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique fruiting display. Ardisia albipedicellata prefers moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it suitable for shaded garden environments.
